ThingDef.label: ship hull (unpowered)
ThingDef.description: The outer structural elements of a ship's hull. Does not include conduits for power or coolant.

ThingDef.label: ship hull
ThingDef.description: The outer structural elements of a ship's hull. Includes conduits for power, life-support gases, and coolant.

ThingDef.Name: ShipCorner
ThingDef.description: Angled armor for a ship's outer hull.

ThingDef.label: solar generator
ThingDef.description: Produces electricity from sunlight. Up to 600W in space and 300W on planet surface. Does not work in the dark or under artificial light.

ThingDef.label: ship vent
ThingDef.description: Exchanges heat with the coolant network, cooling or heating a ship's interior to the desired temperature.\n\nCan also heat rooms with electricity.

ThingDef.label: ship airlock
ThingDef.description: Allows access to a ship or divides rooms inside it. Low-energy plasma barriers prevent gases from escaping.

ThingDef.label: docking clamp
ThingDef.description:
One half of a system for attaching spacecraft. Place two of these directly adjacent to a vacuum-facing airlock, facing outward: |o| where | represents a docking clamp and o represents the airlock. The airlock will then gain the ability to extend a docking tube up to 3 tiles long.

No special equipment is necessary on the other end; simply line the tube up with the other ship's airlock. You can also connect it to other airlocks.

The tube is not rated for interplanetary travel or atmospheric re-entry so ships will automatically decouple.

ThingDef.label: hull plating
ThingDef.description: Spaceworthy hull plating. Designates this tile (and any objects built on it) as part of a ship. Must be placed inside an outer hull.

ThingDef.Name: ShipHardpoint
ThingDef.description: Support structure for attaching buildings and turrets to a ship's exterior. Anything built atop this will be considered part of the ship.\n\nIntegrated nano-composite armor reduces damage to turrets placed atop this hardpoint by half.

ThingDef.label: small rocket engine
ThingDef.description:
A chemfuel-powered engine capable of launching a ship into orbit. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.

Thrust: 500
Fuel use: 1 chemfuel/s
Max takeoff strength: 750

ThingDef.label: rocket engine
ThingDef.description:
A chemfuel-powered engine capable of launching a ship into orbit. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.

Thrust: 1000
Fuel use: 2 chemfuel/s
Max takeoff strength: 1000

ThingDef.label: nuclear engine
ThingDef.description:
A nuclear-powered engine capable of launching a ship into orbit. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.

Thrust: 3000
Fuel use: 3 fuel pods/s
Max takeoff strength: 4000

ThingDef.label: RCS thruster
ThingDef.description: A small thruster that is required to reposition ships. One is required for every 2000 weight.

ThingDef.label: Johnson-Tanaka drive
ThingDef.description:
An advanced reactionless engine capable of interplanetary and interstellar travel.

Cannot be used inside a planet's atmosphere.

JT mass limit: 10000
Thrust: 500

ThingDef.label: large Johnson-Tanaka drive
ThingDef.description:
An advanced reactionless engine capable of interplanetary and interstellar travel.

Cannot be used inside a planet's atmosphere. This larger version, usually found on big warships, utilizes two manifolds in a more efficient configuration.

JT mass limit: 30000
Thrust: 2000

ThingDef.label: pilot console
ThingDef.description: Allows colonists to pilot a starship.

ThingDef.label: tactical console
ThingDef.description: Provides weapon selection and targeting options. Increases weapon accuracy based on operator shooting skill.

ThingDef.label: science console
ThingDef.description: Allows colonists to scan for objects of interest, observe sites from orbit and scan enemy ship interiors in combat.

ThingDef.label: drone core
ThingDef.description: A simple computer core housing a subpersona AI. Incapable of creative problem-solving or interstellar guidance, it is nonetheless effective at piloting a ship in combat.

ThingDef.label: ship computer core
ThingDef.description: A computer core capable of housing a superhumanlike AI who can pilot your ship, accurately fire its weapons, or guide it on interstellar journeys. Includes a mechanite breeding tank which allows the AI to manifest a formgel avatar.

ThingDef.label: basic sensors
ThingDef.description: Basic ship sensors required for ship operation. Allow a ship to reach orbit or observe an area to land at once in orbit.

ThingDef.label: advanced sensors
ThingDef.description: Advanced ship sensors. Automatically scans for nearby sites of interest. Capable of scanning the interiors of enemy ships.

ThingDef.label: Life Support System
ThingDef.description: Recycles oxygen in all fully-enclosed ship rooms. Required to keep non-cryptosleeping colonists and animals alive.\n\nWhile one one life-support system is necessary per ship, having backups can save the crew in an emergency.

ThingDef.label: Small Life Support System
ThingDef.description: Recycles oxygen in all fully-enclosed ship rooms. Required to keep non-cryptosleeping colonists and animals alive. This version sacrifices power efficiency for a more compact design that can fit on small ships.\n\nWhile one one life-support system is necessary per ship, having backups can save the crew in an emergency.

ThingDef.label: ship capacitor
ThingDef.description: Efficiently stores up to 1,000Wd of energy.

ThingDef.label: capacitor array
ThingDef.description: Efficiently stores up to 10,000Wd of energy.

ThingDef.label: ship fission reactor
ThingDef.description: A compact, self-contained fission reactor. Burns uranium fuel pods. Vents heat into a heatsink network if available, or into the surrounding room if not.\n\nIts base power production of 10,000W can be boosted with several increasingly risky overdrive modes.

ThingDef.label: small fission reactor
ThingDef.description: A compact, self-contained fission reactor. Burns uranium fuel pods. Vents heat into a heatsink network if available, or into the surrounding room if not.\n\nIts base power production of 3,000W can be boosted with several increasingly risky overdrive modes.

ThingDef.label: shuttle bay
ThingDef.description: Provides docking facilities for shuttles. This advanced maintenance bay uses mechanites to automatically repair damaged components up to half health, and will double the rate at which pawns perform repairs. It will also automatically refuel docked shuttles from its internal storage.\n\nMust be kept clear of obstructions. Imperial shuttles can land on this without beacons.

ThingDef.label: large shuttle bay
ThingDef.description: Provides docking facilities for shuttles, including the superheavy version. This advanced maintenance bay uses mechanites to automatically repair damaged components up to half health, and will double the rate at which pawns perform repairs. It will also automatically refuel docked shuttles from its internal storage.\n\nMust be kept clear of obstructions. Imperial shuttles can land on this without beacons.

ThingDef.label: salvage bay
ThingDef.description: Moves wrecks to your map or removes unwanted ones. More bays are required to move larger ships.\n\nWeight limit: 5000

ThingDef.label: glittertech salvage bay
ThingDef.description: Unlike the normal salvage bay this version uses a tractor beam based on a reverse JT principle. Moves wrecks to your map or removes unwanted ones. It can also retrieve small loose objects from around enemy wrecks. \n\nWeight limit: 10000

ThingDef.label: cloaking device
ThingDef.description: Generates a field which masks heat emissions, hiding your ship from passive scans. This prevents random ship battles from starting, but is not helpful once combat has already begun. It also cannot protect you from the powerful scanners used to find ships with high Notoriety.\n\nWhile the device is active, your ship's heat sinks will be disabled and heat capacity will decrease.

ThingDef.label: ship cryptosleep casket
ThingDef.description: A cryptosleep casket with multiple built-in timers and contingencies. Can be opened without manual intervention. In the event of catastrophic ship failure, it can also act as an escape pod.\n\nIt would be a good idea to have at least one of these aboard any starship.

ThingDef.label: spacer crib
ThingDef.description: A high-tech bed perfect for a sleepy baby. In the event of life support failure, a protective shell will close around the occupant, recycling oxygen and regulating temperature. It also functions as an escape pod if the ship is critically damaged.\n\nIt is not a cryptosleep casket and cannot keep its occupant alive during interstellar journeys.

ThingDef.label: crittersleep caskets (8)
ThingDef.description: An array of self-powered sarcophagi capable of keeping up to eight small animals in stasis. Animals should be medically anesthetized before being placed into cryptosleep.

ThingDef.label: crittersleep caskets (32)
ThingDef.description: A large array of self-powered sarcophagi capable of keeping up to thirty-two small animals in stasis. Animals should be medically anesthetized before being placed into cryptosleep.

ThingDef.label: cryptonest
ThingDef.description: A self-powered sarcophagus capable of keeping up to sixteen eggs in stasis.

ThingDef.label: afterlife casket
ThingDef.description: A tank of advanced mechanites capable of dismantling a deceased human body and constructing a formgel swarm which mimics the subject's original biological functions.\nThe subject's consciousness is transferred with perfect fidelity to an artificial neuro-psychic substrate which remains in the tank, remotely controlling its formgel via psychic entanglement. An afterlife casket can preserve only a single consciousness at a time.

ThingDef.label: hullfoam distributor
ThingDef.description: A pumping station for distributing hullfoam throughout a ship. When a portion of the ship's hull is destroyed in combat, this system will automatically patch the hole with hullfoam.

ThingDef.label: hullfoam
ThingDef.description: An airtight slab of hullfoam.

ThingDef.label: hullfoam plating
ThingDef.description: Airtight hullfoam, sprayed to replace a missing hull plate.

ThingDef.label: airlock wall
ThingDef.description: An airtight extended airlock wall.

ThingDef.label: airlock wall
ThingDef.description: An airtight extended airlock wall.

ThingDef.label: wall sun lamp
ThingDef.description: An wall-mounted sun lamp that lights an area brightly enough to grow crops, but consumes a large amount of power. Automatically turns itself off at night. It is less powerful than a standing sun lamp, but can be mounted on walls.

ThingDef.label: ship blueprint (Heavy bomber)
ThingDef.description:
A three stage reusable blueprint that can be used to build a complete space ship as long as one is capable of constructing the individual parts. Can be customized at any point but the next stage will only place prints when the required parts under them are already built.

Class: Heavy bomber
A heavily armed ship but incapable of extended operations in space.

Mass: 1092
Size: 28 x 26
T/W ratio: 3.151
Combat rating: 130

Weapons: 
1x large railgun turret
2x laser turret
2x torpedo launcher
2x plasma turret

Required resources: 
steel: 5447
plasteel: 1937
advanced component: 91
component: 168
uranium: 160
silver: 225
gold: 4

Required research for full construction:
First stage:
starflight basics, electricity, air conditioning
Second stage:
rocket propulsion
Third stage:
ship navigation, cruiser armaments, heatsinks, ship fission reactor, laser turrets, basic ship sensors, firefoam, ship shields, capacitor arrays, ship torpedoes, plasma turrets, ship life support

ThingDef.label: ship blueprint (Firefly class transport)
ThingDef.description:
A three stage reusable blueprint that can be used to build a complete space ship as long as one is capable of constructing the individual parts. Can be customized at any point but the next stage will only place prints when the required parts under them are already built.

ship computer core, cruiser armaments, escape pods, laser turrets, flatscreen television, shuttle bay, hospital bed, vitals monitor, capacitor arrays, fabrication, heatsinks, plasma turrets, ship shields, salvage bay, firefoam, machining, capital ship armaments, ship torpedoes, purge ports, hydroponics, drug production, ship navigation, microelectronics, advanced ship sensors, complex furniture, hullfoam, ship life support

ThingDef.label: New Ship Position
ThingDef.description: Select where you would like to move the ship.

ThingDef.label: ship hull
ThingDef.description: The outer structural elements of a ship's hull. Includes conduits for power, life-support gases, and coolant.

ThingDef.label: starting pawn spawner
ThingDef.description: Will spawn starting pawns on this location instead of resorting to backups - crypto casket, salvage bay, bridge. Use only on starting maps.

ThingDef.label: dummy def
ThingDef.description: Don't use this. It exists only because Dubs has so far refused to fix things on his end.

ThingDef.label: DO NOT USE debug micro drone core
ThingDef.description: DO NOT USE IN ACTUAL GAMEPLAY. A simple computer core housing a subpersona AI. Incapable of creative problem-solving or interstellar guidance, it is nonetheless effective at piloting a ship in combat.

ThingDef.label: DO NOT USE debug micro rocket engine
ThingDef.description:
DO NOT USE IN ACTUAL GAMEPLAY. A chemfuel-powered engine capable of launching a ship into orbit. Not suitable for interplanetary travel.

Thrust: 500
Fuel use: 1 chemfuel/s
Max takeoff strength: 750

ThingDef.label: DO NOT USE debug strong hull plating
ThingDef.description: DO NOT USE IN ACTUAL GAMEPLAY. Spaceworthy hull plating. Designates this tile (and any objects built on it) as part of a ship. Must be placed inside an outer hull.

ThingDef.label: DO NOT USE debug strong ship hull
ThingDef.description: DO NOT USE IN ACTUAL GAMEPLAY. The outer structural elements of a ship's hull. Includes conduits for power, life-support gases, and coolant.
